title: Serif headline fonts
content:
I am looking for a good serif font to use for headlines in a newspaper. I will pick the font for the body based on the headline font so that is not an issue.

I like Le Monde journal, if you can recommend fonts that are similar to that one - that would be great.

Thanks in advance.
author: michael_b

comments.content:
[FF Scala](http://web.archive.org/web/20110521102029/http:/en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FF_Scala) is somewhat similar to Le Monde headlines. It's a beautiful typeface AND it has a sans version.

———————————————————-  
 [Read Between the Leading podcast](http://web.archive.org/web/20110521102029/http:/rbtl.us/) | [Pixelspread](http://web.archive.org/web/20110521102029/http:/pixelspread.com/)

There are not many "oldstyle" news headline faces like Le Monde Journal.  
Here's another, [Pratt Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20110521102029/http:/www.shinntype.com/pratt.html).

Even older style: [Nicholas](http://web.archive.org/web/20110521102029/http:/www.shinntype.com/nicholas.html).
